results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel or People”.
Deals with the problem of how far should a supervisor delve into the personal life and problems of staff in order to help with personal problems. Cast includes Jack Thompson.

results.title: Stirring the pool
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Peter Weir, Commonwealth Public Service Board and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel or People”.
A new typist is asked to do a job for the manager instead of the senior typist, who is not present. Afterwards the senior typist voices her resentment, causing the new girl to feel unhappy. Another typist informs the new typist that the attitude of the senior typist is not new and has caused many resignations. What is the answer to internal warfare in the typing pool? Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gil Brealey, Peter Weir, Commonwealth Public Service Board and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Developing managerial talent
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Personnel Management”.
This film deals with the personnel side of management and enterprises where this function falls upon a particular manager. Discusses the recruiting and training of managers.

results.title: Man for the job
results.creator_credit: Margaret Smith, Gregory Clegg and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Personnel Management”.
Explains job analysis and techniques of ability testing, illustrated by two case studies of applications from the personnel manager’s point of view.

results.title: Supervisory conferences
results.creator_credit: Art Babbitt, Edward L. Gershman, McGraw-Hill Text-Films and Academy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”
Dramatised incidents in an industrial plant are used to show how conferences on the supervisory level lead to effective handling, training and utilisation of employees.

results.title: Job evaluation and merit rating
results.creator_credit: Art Babbitt, Edward L. Gershman, Academy Productions and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
Situations in an industrial plant are used to show the value of analysing accurately the type of work required in jobs on different levels and of rating objectively the performances of individual employees at their assigned tasks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Art Babbitt, Edward L. Gershman, Academy Productions and McGraw-Hill Films
